details.text: Choose the correct form of 'to be': I ___ a student.
Choose the negative form: 'He is a student.'
Select the correct short answer: 'Are they at home?'
We often ____ TV in the evenings.
Look! The dog ____ in the garden.
My father ____ to work every day by car.
The children ____ outside at the moment.
Lisa usually ____ (travels / stays at home** / works) on weekends.
She went to the city with ____ (her brother / Anna** / her teacher).
At the museum, Anna liked the ____ (paintings / statues** / photos).
For lunch, Lisa had ____ (pizza / pasta** / salad).
Lisa bought a new ____ (jacket** / bag / phone) because it was on sale.
In the evening they felt ____ (angry / tired but happy** / bored).
The ____ protects the brain. (cranium** / mandible / scapula)
The lower jaw bone is called the ____ . (mandible** / maxilla / clavicle)
The ____ is commonly called the shoulder blade. (scapula** / sternum / pelvis)
The rib ____ protects the heart and lungs. (cage** / belt / bridge)
The upper arm bone is the ____ . (humerus** / femur / radius)
The two bones of the lower arm are the ____.
The longest and strongest bone in the body is the ____ . (femur** / tibia / fibula)
The kneecap is also known as the ____ . (patella** / pelvis / clavicle)
Half of your body’s bones are in the ____ .
She usually ____ to school by bus.
We often ____ TV in the evenings.
What time ____ you usually wake up?
What ____ she usually eat for breakfast?
We ____ to music at the moment.
She usually ____ coffee in the morning.
They ____ to the park every Saturday.
She are reading a book now.
He goes to school every day.
A: What ____ you usually do on Sundays?
B: I usually ____ football with my friends.
A: And what ____ you doing now?
B: I ____ my homework at the moment.
